rule: Company names must be listed in a comma-separated format following the label "Company names:".
input: Text: Our meeting with Tesla and Apple was insightful, but both Elon Musk and Tim Cook were skeptical about the blockchain, AI, and sustainability topics.
output:
Company names: Tesla, Apple  
People names: Elon Musk, Tim Cook  
Specific topics: blockchain, AI, sustainability  
General themes: technology, innovation, skepticism, corporate strategy
complianceText:
The chatbot output maintains the desired format as described. It organizes extracted elements into distinct categories: "Company names," "People names," "Specific topics," and "General themes," each followed by a colon and a comma-separated list of entries or a hyphen-separated list, as mentioned in the description. Each section pertains to the categories specified in the description. The output observes the correct formatting syntax by separating each category with a newline and listing the elements correctly after the respective label. Since there is no violation of the provided format or description, the evaluation leads to compliance.

OK
